pages.text: $(item)Ship hull$() is an important part of your ship appearance and defense. Hull blocks provide different type of direct and indirect damage absorption.$(br2)Higher tiers may sustain multiple hits before degrading into a lower tier. Basic tier is fairly weak and break easily, causing breach in your ship.
Hulls are available in many different textures and shapes.

pages.title: Basic hull (plain)
pages.text: All hulls comes in 16 different textures/colors.$(br2)Basic hull is also craftable from aluminium, bronze and steel, where available.

pages.title: Advanced hull (plain)
pages.text: Only plain hulls can be upgraded.$(br2)Dye is optional here.

pages.title: Superior hull (plain)
pages.text: Only plain hulls can be upgraded.$(br2)Dye is optional here.

pages.title: Tiled & tainted variants
pages.text: Smelting a plain hull gives you a tiled variant of it. Craft it alone to get back the original plain.$(br2)Dyes can be used to convert between textures, same as wool.

pages.title: Omnislab variants
pages.text: Omnislabs work both horizontally (like vanilla slab) and vertically. They're also available with tiled variation.$(br)You may easily recycle them.

pages.title: Glass variants
pages.text: Transparent hull offers the same protection as opaque ones. However, they do add a bit of light to your ship. Sadly, due to their glowstone treatment, glass hull can't be recycled nor upgraded.

pages.title: Omnipanel variants
pages.text: Unlike vanilla panels, omnipanel hulls are connecting both horizontally and vertically to full blocks.
Omnipanels can be recycled to glass hull.
